intro: Silene graminoidea, commonly known as the grass-like campion, is a flowering plant in the Caryophyllaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. Native to Europe and parts of Asia, it thrives in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and meadows. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–50 cm and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Its morphology and growth habits make it a distinctive and often overlooked member of the flora in its native regions.
